instruction: [INST] Analyze this file to learn MacBook motherboard repair. The 'definitions' section explains key technical terms. The 'threads' section contains real-world repair discussions. Use both sections to understand and learn how to troubleshoot MacBook issues. Posts from username 'larossmann' , 'dukefawks' , and '2informaticos' are posts from trusted experts.[/INST]

definitions.820-00840: What is 820-00840? a LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER.
definitions.820-00875: What is 820-00875? a LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER.
definitions.PP1V8_S0: What is PP1V8_S0? PP1V8_S0 is a power rail that is present when the machine is in an S0 state, meaning it is fully turned on, not sleeping or hiberating .

threads.title: <LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER>820-00840</LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER> No Wi-Fi + No drive detected
threads.message:
Hi,

I've got that MacBook and after first inspection it looks good inside.
I couldn't find any liquid damage or corrosion.

The drive has been tested in another machine and is working fine.
It is clearly a mainboard related issue. The Wi-Fi is also not detected however bluetooth works.

What are the shared components or lines between those 2 problems?
Please don't tell me the CPU?!...

threads.title: <LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER>820-00840</LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER> No Wi-Fi + No drive detected
threads.message:
Did you try PRAM reset?

Check <RESISTOR>R1639</RESISTOR> and <RESISTOR>R1671</RESISTOR>.
Post <CHIP>U3540</CHIP>/740 voltages.

threads.title: <LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER>820-00840</LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER> No Wi-Fi + No drive detected
threads.message:
Hi,

I think you were looking the wrong board model. Those parts do not exist on the board.
BTW, it's a <LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER>820-00875</LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER> however I've checked on the <LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER>820-00840</LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER> (which is very similar) and those parts number you gave me do not exist either.

Thanks

threads.title: <LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER>820-00840</LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER> No Wi-Fi + No drive detected
threads.message:
You're right, I was looking different schematic, probably 00165.
This happens sometime, as I usually have 15-20 pdf schematics open.

Check <RESISTOR>R2011</RESISTOR>/12.

threads.title: <LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER>820-00840</LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER> No Wi-Fi + No drive detected
threads.message:
Both are 100k resistors as expected.
When powered on, the signals are at 3.3V so no reset on both lines.

Regarding the SSD, I have 13V on <SIGNAL>PPBUS_SSD_FLV</SIGNAL>.
I also 3.3V on <SIGNAL>SSD_EN</SIGNAL>.
I have 3.3V on <SIGNAL>SSD_SR_EN_L</SIGNAL> ????
I have 3.3V on <SIGNAL>PP3V3_SSD_FLT</SIGNAL>
L8630 is testing fine (4 ohms)
I am getting 1.8V on the <SIGNAL>PP1V8_S0</SIGNAL>

Anything else I could test?

threads.title: <LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER>820-00840</LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER> No Wi-Fi + No drive detected
threads.message:
"L8630 is testing fine (4 ohms)"
4 ohm in a coil???
That's no good; run wires instead...

threads.title: <LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER>820-00840</LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER> No Wi-Fi + No drive detected
threads.message:
My reading might be a little bit off with the probes.
I am getting 3 ohms on a known good board for that coil.

threads.title: <LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER>820-00840</LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER> No Wi-Fi + No drive detected
threads.message:
Do you get 3V on all pins of <RESISTOR>R2011</RESISTOR>/12?

Compare voltages and diode mode readings between the two boards, on the related areas.

Did someone else work on the board before?
Check for knocked off components...

threads.title: <LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER>820-00840</LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER> No Wi-Fi + No drive detected
threads.message:
I believe somebody has it in hands but it looks like nothing was done.
I am just wondering if they could have flashed the Bios with no clean ME region.

Could that be possible that it would be messing up with the drive detection + Wi-Fi on this model?

I can't find any missing components.
And yes I am getting the 3V on both resistors.

threads.title: <LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER>820-00840</LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER> No Wi-Fi + No drive detected
threads.message:
You can try to clean ME region.
Do you have Medusa programmer?

threads.title: <LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER>820-00840</LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER> No Wi-Fi + No drive detected
threads.message:
Nope I don't.

Can you provide a Bios with a Clean ME region for this model please?

threads.title: <LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER>820-00840</LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER> No Wi-Fi + No drive detected
threads.message:
Try this as is, do not change the serial yet...
[URL unfurl="true"]https://drive.google.com/open?id=1LG3gKv3fU1177Qq-quX0FJbkpxxnFEwD[/URL]

threads.title: <LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER>820-00840</LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER> No Wi-Fi + No drive detected
threads.message:
My bad!... The board is a <LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER>820-00875</LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER> so Bios did not work.
The board did power up but was brain dead. Fan wentfull speed and nothing else happened.

Any Bios with Clean ME for an <LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER>820-00875</LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER>.

Thanks!

threads.title: <LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER>820-00840</LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER> No Wi-Fi + No drive detected
<LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER>820-00840</LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER> No Wi-Fi + No drive detected
threads.message:
Nevermind it's not the Bios. I've tried one and same results.
I will investigate the board more when I have some free time.

threads.title: <LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER>820-00840</LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER> No Wi-Fi + No drive detected
